result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Jovanovic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not to operate motor vehicle without valid driver's license
Maintain full time employment
Prescription medication made available to agent and remains in original container
Absolute sobriety
Random testing
No to enter any establishment where purpose is sale of alcohol
Any programming deemed appropriate by Agent including AODA

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Rescheduled from 9/20/16 due to jury trial on Court's calendar
Sentencing hearing on September 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph W Jovanovic in court with attorney Jack Alan Umpleby.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to read in and dismiss counts 2-4 and 6. State recommends Ct1:5 years WSP with 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to any sentence serving. Ct5: 3 years WSP with 1 1/2 years initial confinement and 1 1/2 years extended supervision. CC to Ct 1 but consecutive to any sentence serving.  Ct 7:  6 months jail consecutive to all other counts. Court examines defendant on plea questionnaire. Defendant changes plea to guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI. Counsel moves to have cash bail reinstated; no objection by state. Court to take under advisement until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No controlled substances or prescription medication without prescription from physician and in conformity with said prescription.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Status hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph W Jovanovic by video from the Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint, waives its reading, and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts.  State makes recommendation as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Status hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

4:10pm Call with defense counsel Atty Umpelby who advised that he will be unavailable to appear for a bail hearing tomorrow. Counsel's next appearance in Br 3 is 8/3/16 at 10:00am. Request for this case to be set for that date/time if possible.
Defendant arrived late for court and was taken into custody.  Warrant forwarded to jail.

Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel unaware of why client is not present. State requests warrant. Based on non-appearance the court will forfeit bail and issue an arrest warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph W Jovanovic in court with attorney Jack Alan Umpleby.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set for plea hearing today. Counsel states his client wants to hire private counsel. Court will recall case to allow defendant to speak with his attorney.
4:29pm Case recalled, same appearances. Counsel will remain on the case and requests plea date one month out. Court denies hearing that far out.
Plea hearing on June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:45pm Case recalled. Defendant now appears with counsel. Shannon Whitworth appears for State of Wisconsin. Court with draws warrant and forfeiture of any bail. Counsel requesting a disposition date in June, May 16/16 hearing removed set for plea/sentencing 6/20/16.
